parameters.definition: Time for fertilizer to be effective per unit
Time for seeds to be effective per unit
Maximum combined units of fertilizer and seeds
Minimum units of fertilizer to be added
Maximum ratio of the amount of fertilizer to seeds

description: Both fertilizer and seeds need to be added to a lawn. One unit of fertilizer takes \param{TimeFertilizer} minutes to be effective while one unit of seeds takes \param{TimeSeeds} minutes to be effective. There can be at most \param{MaxUnits} units of fertilizer and seeds combined added to the lawn. In addition at least \param{MinFertilizer} units of fertilizer need to be added. Since the lawn is really patchy, there can be at most \param{MaxFertilizerSeedRatio} times the amount of fertilizer as seeds. How many units of each should be added to minimize the total time it takes for the lawn to be ready?
